title: Distraught Rebekah Vardy in floods of tears as she lands back in UK amid Coleen Rooney row
text:

Pregnant Rebekah Vardy looked distraught and was in floods of tears as she arrived back in the UK.

The wife of footballer Jamie Vardy cut short her Dubai holiday to return home after becoming looked in a bitter row with Coleen Rooney .

Wayne Rooney's wife has accused Rebekah of leaking stories about her to a national newspaper.

Coleen, who has been nicknamed Wagatha Christie, laid a trap by putting fake stories on her private Instagram account and making it so only Rebekah's account could see them.

When her fake news leaked, Coleen told the world in an epic statement that it was "Rebekah Vardy's account" who had been passing on her private info.

(Image: PA)

Rebekah, who is heavily pregnant with her and Jamie's third child together, furiously denied the claims and said she was "disgusted" that she even had to deny it.

It was reported she was cutting her Dubai holiday short and coming home to hire forensic IT experts to prove it wasn't her who leaked the stories.

And as she touched down at Heathrow Airport, it was clear she was visibly upset.

In pictures obtained by The Sun , Rebekah, 37, wipes tears from her eyes as she walks hand-in-hand with her husband.

Dressed in a grey jumper and joggers, the WAG's face is twisted in distress as she makes her way home.

(Image: Getty Images)

It comes after friends of Coleen claim she suspected Rebekah was the leak for years.

A spokesperson for Coleen also said she had "irrefutable" proof that it's Rebekah who has been leaking stories about Coleen to the press.

The representative said: "It is irrefutable that the leaks came from one account, and one account only."

After it all kicked off, Rebekah hit back in her own statement.

(Image: waynerooney/Instagram)

She wrote: "As I have just said to you on the phone, I wish you had called me if you thought this.

"I never speak to anyone about you as various journalists who have asked me to over the years can vouch for.

"If you thought this was happening you could have told me & I could have changed my passwords to see if it stopped.

"Over the years various people have had access to my insta & just this week I found I was following people I didn't know and have never followed myself.

(Image: Twitter)

"I'm not being funny but I don't need the money, what would I gain from selling stories on you?

"I liked you a lot Coleen & I'm so upset that you have chosen to do this, especially when I'm heavily pregnant.

"I'm disgusted that I'm even having to deny this. You should have called me the first time this happened."
